intro: Matricaria coronata, commonly known as the common chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It is characterized by its daisy-like white flowers with a yellow center, which bloom throughout the summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is widely used in herbal medicine and aromatherapy.
